Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi
text: can install development version boreholefuncmwi GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table .
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/boreholefuncmwi") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi
text: package provides access data collected Karonga district (North Malawi) contains answers 20-minute questionnaire boreholes. questionnaire installed koboTooolbox (www.kobotoolbox.org) collect borehole functionality data 300 respondents aged 18 .

title: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi
text: dataset boreholefuncmwi contains data borehole’s management North Malawi. Questions included questionnaire example borehole maintenance contributions community, availability borehole spare parts, tariff collection frequency presence service provider. 108 observations 17 variables. overview variable names, see following table.

title: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi
text: can interesting analyse numbers households draw water borehole village. plot showing distribution boreholes’ use across villages.
code: library(boreholefuncmwi) library(unhcrthemes) library(ggplot2) borehole_user <- boreholefuncmwi %>%   group_by(village) %>%   summarise(number_households = sum(number_households, na.rm = TRUE))  ggplot(borehole_user) +   geom_col(aes(     x = number_households,     y = reorder(village, number_households)   ),   fill = "lightgreen",  # Change the color here to light green   width = 0.8   ) +   geom_text(aes(     x = number_households,     y = reorder(village, number_households),     label = round(number_households)   ),   hjust = -0.5,   size = 8 / .pt   ) +   labs(     title = "Number of households using a borehole",     caption = "Boreholes distribution according to villages"        ) +   scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +   theme_unhcr(     grid = FALSE,     axis = "y",     axis_title = FALSE,     axis_text = "y"   ) # Provide some example code here

what: boreholefuncmwi: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi — boreholefuncmwi
title: boreholefuncmwi: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi — boreholefuncmwi
text: data obtained survey conducted Wasambo Karonga district (Northen Malawi). data boreholes handpumps people mostly rely drinking water, secondary wells rivers. data collected June 2013.

title: boreholefuncmwi: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi — boreholefuncmwi
boreholefuncmwi: Analysis of boreholes' functionality in Northern Malawi — boreholefuncmwi
text: tibble 6 rows 17 variables id Identification number observation date Date survey filled role Main role respondent committee_members many people Hand pump borehole Committee? last_meeting_participants many community members attended last meeting? (99 don?t know) annual_budget much money need manage borehole without financial problems annually? village Name village number_households many households use hand pump borehole? tariff_costs_consider costs considered setting tariff user fee? tariff_frequency often tariff/user fee collected? tariff_amount much tariff/user fee (Kwacha)? total_money much source support operations maintenance annually? tariff_hh_number many households community paid water fee last time collected? distance_materials far away /materials use hand pump borehole repairs? service_provider service provider someone responsible operating /maintaining hand pump borehole water system? preventive_maintenance conduct preventive maintenance? functional_status Functional status borehole
